newsitem.title: USA: Cleveland-Cliffs says sees higher sales.
newsitem.headline: Cleveland-Cliffs says sees higher sales.

text.p: Cleveland-Cliffs Inc on Monday predicted that its 1998 sales volume would be higher than in 1997 and that its total sales volume in 1997 would be about 90 percent of its effective sales capacity.

"A substantial majority of Cliffs' production entitlements is already committed under multi-year contracts, and our total sales volume in 1997 is expected to be about 90 percent of our effective sales capacity," said Thomas Moore, the company's chairman and chief executive.
He added, "If current steel operating rates continue, we expect higher 1998 sales volume since certain unusual reductions in 1997 customer requirements are not expected to repeat."
